explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_liquids.rationale: It was classified as Category 3 (GHS standards: flash point being 23 degC or more and 60 degC or less) as flash point being 39 degC (closed cup).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Not classified because of UNRTDG Class: 8 Subsidiary risks Class: 3

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) chemically bonded only to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements).

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Although it is the UNRTDG class 8 (subsidiary risks class 3), it is thought that this is based on skin corrosivenesses. Since there is no data about corrosion behavior, it cannot be classified.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: It was set as Category 5 from lower value LD50=3310 mg/kg (PATTY (5th, 2001)) of two rat LD50 values (3310 and 3530 mg/kg).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was set as Category 4 from rabbit LD50 = 1060mg/kg (PATTY (5th, 2001)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: The saturated vapor pressure concentration of acetates is 20800ppm, and it is presumed that the inhalation test is done in the state of steam. It was classified as out of Category based on rat LCLo = 16000ppm (PATTY (5th, 2001)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: The saturated vapor pressures concentrations pressure of acetates is 20800ppm, and it is presumed that the inhalation study is done in the state of steam. Therefore, there is no data about mists, it cannot classify.

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Skin necrosis and burn (PATTY (5th, 2001)) and corrosion (IUCLID (2004))were observed with application of acetic acid at 50% or more of concentration in animal experiments. Also based on EU-Annex 1:C;R35, etc. it was classified as Category 1A-1C.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Lliquid glacial acetate caused destructive damages to the eye in the rabbit (PATTY (5th, 2001)), and 16% of acetate caused permanent corneal injuries (IUCLID (2004)), paralysis and muddiness of the cornea were remained eternally in the accident in people (PATTY (5th, 2001)). Bassed on the above statement, it was set to Category 1.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Category1; Skin sensitization: Classification not possible
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: (Respiratory sensitization)May cause allegy or asthma symptoms pr breathing difficulties if inhaled; (Skin sensitization)-
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitization: Based on a statement of four case reports that respiratory hypersensitivity, such as bronchial asthmas, was induced by human inhalation exposure, and a fact that occupational asthma has been reportrd( PATTY (5th, 2001).), it was referred to as Category 1. Skin sensitization:No data

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Since there was no data other than the negative result in an in vitro mutagenicity test, we presupposed that we could not categorize it according to the technical guideline.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs (blood system); May cause damage to organs (respiratory organs)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In humans, it is classified into Category 1 (blood) based on the statement that influence of blood such as disseminated intravascular coagulations disorders, severe hemolysis (PATTY (5th, 2001)). Moreover, the stimulative statement to the nose, upper respiratory tract, and lung according to inhalation exposure at humans (PATTY (5th, 2001)), and "humans' inhalation of vapor may occure to respiratory tract corrosiveness and pulmonary oedemas" (ICSC (J) (1997)). So it is classified into Category 2 (respiratory systems).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Enough animal information is not given about the influence after repeated exposure. Although the example is reported in humans(repeated exposure), it was judged that it could not classify taken into consideration the mild symptoms as a case or lack of dignity as a proof.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 24-hour EC50=47mg/L of Crustacea (Daphnia magna), and others (IUCLID, 2000).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since rapidly degrading (BOD: 74% (existing chemical safety inspections data)), and less bio-accumulative (log Kow=-0.17 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).
